Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole tossed seven innings of one-run ball, allowing only one run on six hits with four strikeouts.
Gleyber Torres roped a double on the first pitch of the game, followed by a Juan Soto RBI single.
Giancarlo Stanton drove a ball 117 miles per hour into center field, scoring Aaron Judge.
A double play in the bottom half of the sixth caused both benches to clear.
Vinnie Pasquantino hit a double that scored Bobby Witt Jr. for the Royals' only run.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees manager Aaron Boone expressed confidence in his team, stating, 'Everyone is feeling pretty good about their teams. That’s the case for me.'
Gerrit Cole reflected on his performance, saying, 'It means a lot. It was a big game. It was a fun game. It was a great battle. Just a great battle. Fun to be part of.'
